ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: A good survey of Kant's philosophy of religion, important and worth taking if one has any serious aspirations in theology or in an historical understanding of the philosophy of Religion.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I think that the material is absolutely necessary for someone in this field (philosophy of religion). It is great that there is a course like this, which allows us to focus very closely on Kant. This close focus will certainly be very useful in addressing a wide range of topics in the field.
It allowed me to pursue research interests I had prior to the course and was very helpful in that respect.
